result.execSummary:
The defendant Caslon D Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Caslon D Bell in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as American Sign Language Interpreters, Ashley Hopkamp and Kate Block.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Letter from defendant requesting payment plan.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $258.00 entered as ordered by the court on 06/17/15 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 12/01/15. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Signed, Filed & Distributed, Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.
Br. 36 is unavailable on 10/16/2015, matter is adjourned to 09/18/2015 at 1:30 pm.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Individual Counseling.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Caslon D Bell in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference. Parties have reached a resolution of this matter. Sworn as American Sign Language to English Interpreters - For the Victim: Fay Jordan Peters & Sandy Peplinski - for the Defendant: Maria Kielma & Michael Maffucci. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the sate the court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Caslon D Bell in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in court PRO SE. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Sworn as ASL Interpreters: Sandy Peplinski & Faye Jordan-Peters.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Adam Essling, present in court/in court via telephone, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. Court pre-approved up to 10 HOURS of interpreter services, and ordered attorney Essling to submit any bills to the court forthwith. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month after the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Letter from SPD, defendant NOT eligible for SPD representation.

Court ordered no possession or use of any weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  4/17/15. IF HE FAILS TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR HIS ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Quiana H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 23.

Defendant Caslon D Bell in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter: Kim Ramsay.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Caslon D Bell in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant needs a ASL interpreter.
Case is adjourned to 4-16-2015, at 1:30 pm. Rm. 221, out of custody court.
Notified Jackie of the next court appearance.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
